intro: Puya olivacea, commonly known as the olive torch or silver torch, is a striking plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves. The plant produces a showy inflorescence composed of numerous small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late summer. Puya olivacea is adapted to high-altitude environments and requires well-drained soil and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
